id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [ssd1327 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1327.html#configuration-variables)*

address.docs:
**int**: Manually specify the [I²C](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c) address of the display. Defaults to 0x3D.

*See also: [ssd1327 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1327.html#configuration-variables)*

update_interval.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The interval to re-draw the screen. Defaults to `5s`.

*See also: [ssd1327 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1327.html#configuration-variables)*

CONFIG_SCHEMA.docs:
The `ssd1327_i2c` display platform allows you to use SSD1327 ([datasheet](https://www.generationrobots.com/media/Ecran_OLED_0_96/SSD1327_datasheet.pdf), [Waveshare](https://www.waveshare.com/1.5inch-oled-module.htm)) displays with ESPHome. Note that this component is for displays that are connected via the [I²C Bus](https://esphome.io/components/i2c.html#i2c). If your SSD1327 is connected via the 4-Wire [SPI bus](https://esphome.io/components/spi.html#spi), see [Over SPI](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1327.html#ssd1327-spi).

*See also: [ssd1327 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/display/ssd1327.html#over-i2c)*
